Hackbright scholarship application

Parasite prevalence calculator for dogs in the USA

As a veterinarian, I speak to a lot of pet owners who are confused about parasite prevention.

There are many different products on the market and none of them provide protection against every parasite.

Owners need to know which products are required for their pet based on their location. For this reason, I created a website that pet owners can use to get a better idea of what parasitic diseases are in their area and how best to control them.

I made the website using react and bootstrap with an express server. When the submit button is triggered, a fetch request is sent to /location with the input set as the address argument.

When the submit button is triggered, a fetch request is sent to /location with the input set as the address argument.

To keep my google API key private, I built a small server using express, it listens to /location and when it receives input, appends my googleAPI key and the address argument to a fetch request sent to google geolocation API. The response is then sent back to my website which converts it into a JSON object. 

                       
app.get('/location', (req, res) => {
    //Listens for request with address as the argument. Sends off request to google geolocation API.
    const address = req.query.address;
    const GOOGLEAPI = "********";
    fetch(`https://maps.googleapis.com/maps/api/geocode/json?address=${address}&key=${GOOGLEAPI}`)
        .then(result => result.text())
        .then(response => res.send(response))
    })
